Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly a pelike; exterior: glazed area and a black line above panel; below, black-figure decoration consisting of female and male figures (end of added white beard and raised left arm with trace of added red of male figure remaining, to right; upper part of female wearing himation, looking left with right arm raised and crossing man's arm; faded white on face and arm; black outline for eye and eyebrow; possibly red dots in singles and groups of three on himation).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 471-2, no. B810)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0104) (Phase 1)
